title: 6 of Our Best One-Pot Dinners
description: Get a one-pot recipe for almost every night of the week. These no-fuss dishes will have the family fed quickly with easy clean-up.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 6 of Our Best One-Pot Dinners We can dish it out, with only one dish! Get a one-pot recipe for almost every night of the week. By Emily Boyette Emily Boyette Emily Boyette is a highly qualified editor within the food media industry with eight-plus years of experience. From galleries and listicles to recipe manuscripts and articles, her knowledge of cooking goes beyond text. Emily is a writer for Allrecipes. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Published on April 22, 2021 We've rounded up some of the best one-pot dinners for every type of eater out there. From different meat options like sriracha chicken or skillet pork chops, to vegetarian stews like one-pot ratatouille, there's something for everyone. These no-fuss dishes will have the family fed quickly with easy clean-up. 01 of 06 One Pan Sriracha Chicken and Veggies View Recipe If you're a lover of all things red, you'll love this one-pan dish featuring red bell peppers, red onion, red potatoes, with a sweet and spicy brown sugar-sriracha concoction to glaze the tops of crispy chicken thighs. 02 of 06 Italian Sausage Tortellini Allrecipes View Recipe Create the best Italian dinner at home with this no-fuss, one-pot meal incorporating ingredients from each food group for full satisfaction. Who knew deliciousness could be this convenient? 03 of 06 One Pot Pasta Dinner View Recipe Pasta has never been so perfect. A lot of times, a good pasta sauce can be intimidating. In this Martha Stewart recipe, you just throw everything into the pot and let the stove do the work. The ingredients will come together on their own to create an incredible dish. Don't forget to top with Parmesan! 04 of 06 One-Pot Ratatouille View Recipe Ratatouille, a French dish, is merely a rustic stew; which is an excuse to get away with coarsely chopping everything! Martha Stewart simplifies a classic. Sauté in a large Dutch oven or pot, then cover to allow the ingredients to cook down and release their natural juices. Voilà, you've got dinner on the table! 05 of 06 Sausage and Potato Pan Roast View Recipe A Food & Wine sheet pan dinner with roasted potato wedges, shallots, and Italian sausage. Fresh arugula, lemon juice, and flaky sea salt is added at the end for a one-pan meal masterpiece. The best part? Minimal chopping and on the table in under an hour. Talk about simplicity! 06 of 06 Skillet Pork Chops with Apples and Onions View Recipe Elegant and easy, this hearty Southern Living dish comes with a side and a sauce all in one. Be sure to brown the chops well so they'll give the mustardy pan sauce deep flavor. Get more recipes for one-pot meals. Explore more: Kitchen Tips How To Dinner Fix Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
